p: The belowground effects of S. gigantea invasions were examined at eight sites in the Netherlands, located in either of the distinct semi-natural habitats, namely riparian zones (rive clay soil) and semi-natural grasslands (sandy soil) (see Table 1). For all invaded plots, the coverage by S. gigantea was scored as a 9 on a modified Braun-Blanquet scale [ 25, 26], implying a 75â€“100% coverage. Uninvaded plots were dominated by native plant species, and if S. gigantea was present in the uninvaded plots, its coverage was neglectable.
